title: Desktop keeps crashing after getting sync with mobile
body:
# Bug Report

## Description

Originally issue https://github.com/status-im/status-go/pull/3743 and it is fixed and included to 1.24 on mobile side, but not on desktop side

## Steps to reproduce
Reproduced on certain multiaccounts after sync - desktop keeps crashing after login 

#### Expected behavior
no crash

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: 0.13. RC 42
- Operating System: Mac Os Ventura 13.2.1
- Log: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1R19eIMwCK6tFKo-W14TygkBeZvf3kZza/view?usp=drive_link
Cherry-picking this commit in the status-go release branch should fix it https://github.com/status-im/status-go/commit/3f5f87d1d1551b2570cb662fcd9cefc051096aa

@jrainville 
still have issues with desktop after sync - it keeps crashing from time to time (as far as I saw mostly when the messages are fetching from offline for synced device)

Log: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1U4bptnJuGbt8aLhuRYASZjTRcRysZ5Fs/view?usp=sharing

Desktop version: [RC #46 ](https://ci.infra.status.im/job/status-desktop/job/release/job/release%252F0.13.x/46/)

Console log: 
```

/Users/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/macos/aarch64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/pure/json.nim(824) toKeypairDto
/Users/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/macos/aarch64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/system/assertions.nim(38) failedAssertImpl
/Users/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/macos/aarch64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/system/assertions.nim(28) raiseAssert
/Users/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/macos/aarch64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/system/fatal.nim(54) sysFatal
Error: unhandled exception: /Users/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/macos/aarch64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/pure/json.nim(824, 10) `node.kind == JArray` : items() can not iterate a JsonNode of kind JNull [AssertionDefect]

```
Nim log (from Status/log): [app_20230717_165943.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/files/12071048/app_20230717_165943.log)

Stable reproduction steps:
1. Alice [mobile]: create new account
2. Alice [desktop]: local pairing from Alice [mobile]
3. Bob: send CR to Alice
4. Alice [desktop]: `unknown keypair type  tid=1540105 file=keypair_dto.nim:35 kpType=` (type is an empty string) and further crash on json parsing.

Here's the received event that leads to a crash:
```json
{
    "type": "messages.new",
    "event": {
        "notifications": null,
        "keypairs": [
            {
                "key-uid": "",
                "name": "",
                "type": "",
                "derived-from": "",
                "last-used-derivation-index": 0,
                "synced-from": "",
                "clock": 0,
                "accounts": null
            }
        ],
        "discordOldestMessageTimestamp": 0,
        "ensUsernameDetails": [
            {
                "username": "",
                "chainId": 0,
                "clock": 0,
                "removed": false
            }
        ]
    }
}
```

https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/1fcdf255e41be316574d2375ab20f4012dfd4841/src/app_service/service/wallet_account/keypair_dto.nim#L39

After restarting the desktop app the crash comes there very soon with processing the same retrieved message.

I succeeded to hotfix this by skipping empty sync keypairs, but I think we also should fix this by not sending such messages in the first place. I checked DB on both devices, `keypairs` table seems fine to me, no empty rows. 

Can't reproduce with desktop->desktop üôÅ

Hmmm, I can't reproduce this on desktop `master` branch. 
Will push the hotfix mentioned above and hope for the best üôÇ
